name: Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA)
description: The Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA) is South Africaâ€™s market conduct regulator for financial institutions. Established under the Financial Sector Regulation Act, it oversees the fair treatment of financial customers, enforces conduct standards, and promotes market integrity. The FSCA succeeded the Financial Services Board (FSB) in 2018 and supervises entities offering banking, insurance, retirement, and forex trading services.
